required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Increasing Doses of Inhaled Albuterol in Children With Acute Wheezing Episodes
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Increasing Doses of Inhaled Albuterol Administered by Metered Dose Inhalers in Children With Acute Wheezing Episodes

collaborator.agency: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo

brief_summary.textblock: Metered dose inhalers with spacers are devices capable of providing higher rates of lung deposition of drugs such as beta agonists when compared to conventional nebulizers, but there is no consensus about the optimal dose when this is the device of choice and there is evidence that younger children need proportionally higher doses of albuterol (in μg/kg) when compared to older children. Other factors that may interfere with response to albuterol treatment include the genetics of the beta adrenergic receptor (ADRβ2) and infectious etiology of the wheezing attack. This study will assess the effectiveness of a dose regimen that prioritizes higher doses of albuterol, with doses in μg/kg higher for younger children. Security of this new dosing regimen will be assessed by monitoring clinical side effects and serum levels of albuterol, but the investigators will also examine the presence of 12 different respiratory viruses in these patients and evaluate the influence of ADRβ2 receptor genetics in the response to albuterol. The primary outcome measure will be the need for hospitalization. Secondary outcomes will include a change in clinical score, respiratory rate and forced expiratory volume in the first second, the need for additional treatments and length of stay in the emergency room for those not hospitalized.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a prospective, randomized, double blinded, controlled study. The patients will be randomly assigned to one of the treatment groups (experimental or control groups).
The patients will be assessed 1 hour later and every 30 minutes thereafter until discharge. Following 4 hours in the emergency room, any patient who do not meet the discharge criteria (PRAM score ≤ 3 and SpO2 ≥ 92%) will be admitted to the hospital. Each patient's attending physician will determine the need for additional therapies following the first hour.
Identification of respiratory viruses in the nasal lavage samples wil be performed using the CLART PneumoVir® kit.
Albuterol plasmatic levels will be analyzed via HPLC (High Performance Liquid Chromatography).
To genotype the ADBR2 receptor (blood samples), the gene regions encompassing the Arg16Gly, Gln27Glu, and Arg19Cys Thr164Ile polymorphisms will be amplified via PCR. The resultant amplimers were then sequenced.
A sample of 124 patients (62 in each group) was calculated to provide an 80% power with which to detect a significant difference of at least 30 minutes in the lengths of stay between the groups. The chi-square test will be used to compare hospital admission rates and tremor rates. For all other outcomes, t-tests for mean comparisons (variables with a normal distribution), a Mann Whitney test (nonparametric data) and ANOVA with repeated measures will be used.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Hospital admission was defined as the need to stay in the emergency room for more than 4 hours, due to the failure to meet the discharge criteria (PRAM score ≤ 3 and pulse oximetry, ≥ 92%)

secondary_outcome.measure: Forced Expiratory Volume in the First Second
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in FEV1 one hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline. Spirometry was performed only in subjects older than 6 years and who could perform the maneuver properly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in PRAM Score After One Hour
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One hour post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the Pediatric Respiratory Assessment Measure (PRAM) score one hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline. The PRAM score is used to assess the severity of asthma attacks, it ranges from 0 to 15, and the higher the score, the greater the severity of the attack. We calculated the difference between the PRAM score measured one hour post treatment and the PRAM score at baseline (PRAM score 1 hour - PRAM score baseline). The larger the absolute value of the difference, the better the outcome (e.g., a difference of -4 indicates a better outcome that a difference of -2). minimum value of the difference (Albuterol - Higher Dose, experimental group): -8 maximum value of the difference (Albuterol - Higher Dose, experimental group): 0 minimum value of the difference (Albuterol - Lower Dose, control group): -8 maximum value of the difference (Albuterol - Lower Dose, control group): 0

secondary_outcome.measure: Albuterol Determination in the Plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Albuterol determination in the plasma was carried out at at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment), dosage was accomplished by High Performance Liquid Chromatography.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Glucose Serum Levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in glucose serum levels at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Electrocardiogram at Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Electrocardiogram performed at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Respiratory Rate After One Hour
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in respiratory rate one hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Need for Additional Therapies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: The need for additional therapies such as magnesium sulphate or intravenous albuterol were recorded

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in PRAM Score at Discharge or Hospital Admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the Pediatric Respiratory Assessment Measure (PRAM) score at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline. The PRAM score is used to assess the severity of asthma attacks, it ranges from 0 to 15, and the higher the score, the greater the severity of the attack. We calculated the difference between the PRAM score measured at discharge or admission and the PRAM score at baseline (PRAM score discharge or admission - PRAM score baseline). The larger the absolute value of the difference, the better the outcome (e.g., a difference of -4 indicates a better outcome that a difference of -2). minimum value of the difference (Albuterol - Higher Dose, experimental group): -9 maximum value of the difference (Albuterol - Higher Dose, experimental group): 0 minimum value of the difference (Albuterol - Lower Dose, control group): -9 maximum value of the difference (Albuterol - Lower Dose, control group): 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Potassium Serum Levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in potassium serum levels at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Bicarbonate Serum Levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in bicarbonate serum levels at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Respiratory Rate at at Discharge or Hospital Admission.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in respiratory rate at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pulse Oximetry One Hour Post-treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in pulse oximetry one hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Pulse Oximetry at Discharge or Hospital Admission.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in pulse oximetry at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Heart Rate After One Hour
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in heart rate one hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Heart Rate at Discharge or Hospital Admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in heart rate at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Electrocardiogram One Hour Post-treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One hour post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Electrocardiogram one hour post-treatment to identify possible rhythm disturbances.

secondary_outcome.measure: Electrocardiogram at Discharge or Hospital Admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Electrocardiogram at discharge or hospital admission to identify possible rhythm disturbances.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lengths of Stay in the Emergency Room
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one to four hours
secondary_outcome.description: lengths of stay in the emergency room for discharged patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Admission Rates in Patients With and Without Any Virus Detected
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Admission rates in patients with and without any of the following viruses detected by PCR in nasal lavage samples: Adenovirus; Bocavirus; Coronavirus; Enterovirus (Echovirus); Influenza (A H3N2, A H1N1/2009, B and C); Metapneumovirus (subtypes A and B); Parainfluenza 1, 2, 3 and 4 (subtypes A and B); Rhinovirus; Respiratory Syncytial Virus type A and Respiratory Syncytial Virus type B.

secondary_outcome.measure: Admission Rates in Patients With and Without Rhinovirus Detect
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Admission rates in patients with and without rhinovirus detected by PCR in nasal lavage samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: Admission Rates in Patients With the Arg16Gly Polymorphisms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Admission rates in patients with the Arg16Gly polymorphisms of the beta-2 adrenergic receptor (Arg16Gly, Arg16Arg and Gly16Gly genotypes).

arm_group.description: Albuterol dosages during the first hour include 900 mcg (up to 15 kg), 1200 mcg (> 15 to 20 kg), 1500 mcg (> 20 to 25 kg) and 1800 mcg (> 25 kg).
Albuterol dosages during the first hour include either 600 mcg (up to 25 kg) or 1200 mcg (> 25 kg).

intervention.description: The Experimental group will receive higher doses of albuterol in the first hour: 900 mcg (up to 15 kg), 1200 mcg (> 15 to 20 kg), 1500 mcg (> 20 to 25 kg) and 1800 mcg (> 25 kg).
The Control group will receive the following doses of albuterol in the first hour 600 mcg (up to 25 kg) or 1200 mcg (> 25 kg)

overall_official.last_name: Luiz Vicente RF Silva Filho, MD

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Luiz Vicente Ribeiro Ferreira da Silva Filho

group.title: Albuterol - Higher Dose (Experimental)
group.description: Dosing will be individualized in four categories according to body weight Albuterol - Experimental: The Experimental group will receive higher doses of albuterol in the first hour: up to 15 kg of weight: 900 mcg; 15 to 20 kg: 1200 mcg; 20 to 25 kg: 1500; more than 25 kg: 1800 mcg

group.title: Albuterol - Lower Dose (Control)
group.description: Dosing will be dived according to consensus recommendations in only two categories according to body weight Albuterol - Control: The Control group will receive 600 mcg for those with weight under 25kg and 1200 mcg for those grater than 25 kg

group.title: Experimental Group
group.description: Dosing will be individualized in four categories according to body weight Albuterol - Experimental: The Experimental group will receive higher doses of albuterol in the first hour: up to 15 kg of weight: 900 mcg; 15 to 20 kg: 1200 mcg; 20 to 25 kg: 1500; more than 25 kg: 1800 mcg

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Dosing will be dived according to consensus recommendations in only two categories according to body weight Albuterol - Control: The Control group will receive 600 mcg for those with weight under 25kg and 1200 mcg for those grater than 25 kg

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Albuterol Determination in the Plasma

outcome.population: It was possible to obtain albuterol plasma levels from 52 patients in the study group and 51 in the control group (in the other samples, this analysis was not feasible due to hemolysis).

outcome.description: Change in the Pediatric Respiratory Assessment Measure (PRAM) score at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline. The PRAM score is used to assess the severity of asthma attacks, it ranges from 0 to 15, and the higher the score, the greater the severity of the attack. We calculated the difference between the PRAM score measured at discharge or admission and the PRAM score at baseline (PRAM score discharge or admission - PRAM score baseline). measure.title: Changes in Respiratory Rate at at Discharge or Hospital Admission.
measure.description: Changes in respiratory rate at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

outcome.title: Change in Pulse Oximetry One Hour Post-treatment
outcome.description: Change in pulse oximetry one hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline
outcome.time_frame: One hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline

group.title: Albuterol - Higher Dose (Experimental)
group.description: Dosing will be individualized in four categories according to body weight Albuterol - Experimental: The Experimental group will receive higher doses of albuterol in the first hour: up to 15 kg of weight: 900 mcg; 15 to 20 kg: 1200 mcg; 20 to 25 kg: 1500; more than 25 kg: 1800 mcg

group.title: Albuterol - Lower Dose (Control)
group.description: Dosing will be dived according to consensus recommendations in only two categories according to body weight Albuterol - Control: The Control group will receive 600 mcg for those with weight under 25kg and 1200 mcg for those grater than 25 kg

measure.title: Change in Pulse Oximetry One Hour Post-treatment
measure.description: Change in pulse oximetry one hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline

outcome.title: Changes in Pulse Oximetry at Discharge or Hospital Admission.
outcome.description: Changes in pulse oximetry at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

outcome.population: No electrocardiographic abnormalities were detected im both groups

measure.title: Lengths of Stay in the Emergency Room
measure.description: lengths of stay in the emergency room for discharged patients

outcome.title: Admission Rates in Patients With and Without Any Virus Detected
outcome.description: Admission rates in patients with and without any of the following viruses detected by PCR in nasal lavage samples: Adenovirus; Bocavirus; Coronavirus; Enterovirus (Echovirus); Influenza (A H3N2, A H1N1/2009, B and C); Metapneumovirus (subtypes A and B); Parainfluenza 1, 2, 3 and 4 (subtypes A and B); Rhinovirus; Respiratory Syncytial Virus type A and Respiratory Syncytial Virus type B.
outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)
outcome.population: We obtained nasal lavage samples from 117 individuals, in two patients it was not possible to collect nasal lavage samples.

group.title: Virus Detected
group.description: patients with any virus detected by PCR

group.title: No Virus Detected
group.description: patients with no virus detected by PCR

measure.title: Admission Rates in Patients With and Without Any Virus Detected
measure.description: Admission rates in patients with and without any of the following viruses detected by PCR in nasal lavage samples: Adenovirus; Bocavirus; Coronavirus; Enterovirus (Echovirus); Influenza (A H3N2, A H1N1/2009, B and C); Metapneumovirus (subtypes A and B); Parainfluenza 1, 2, 3 and 4 (subtypes A and B); Rhinovirus; Respiratory Syncytial Virus type A and Respiratory Syncytial Virus type B.
measure.population: We obtained nasal lavage samples from 117 individuals, in two patients it was not possible to collect nasal lavage samples.

outcome.description: Admission rates in patients with and without rhinovirus detected by PCR in nasal lavage samples.
outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)
outcome.population: We obtained nasal lavage samples from 117 individuals, in two patients it was not possible to collect nasal lavage samples.

group.title: Rhinovirus Detected
group.description: patients with rhinovirus detected by PCR

outcome.title: Admission Rates in Patients With the Arg16Gly Polymorphisms
outcome.description: Admission rates in patients with the Arg16Gly polymorphisms of the beta-2 adrenergic receptor (Arg16Gly, Arg16Arg and Gly16Gly genotypes).
outcome.time_frame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)
outcome.population: The sequencing of the beta-2 adrenergic receptor gene was performed in a subset of 60 patients, in the other samples these analysis were not feasible due to hemolysis.

group.title: Arg16Gly Patients
group.description: Patients carrying the Arg16Gly genotype

group.title: Gly16Gly Patients
group.description: Patients carrying the Gly16Gly genotype

group.title: Arg16Arg Patients
group.description: Patients carrying the Arg16Arg genotype

measure.title: Admission Rates in Patients With the Arg16Gly Polymorphisms
measure.description: Admission rates in patients with the Arg16Gly polymorphisms of the beta-2 adrenergic receptor (Arg16Gly, Arg16Arg and Gly16Gly genotypes).
measure.population: The sequencing of the beta-2 adrenergic receptor gene was performed in a subset of 60 patients, in the other samples these analysis were not feasible due to hemolysis.

reported_events.time_frame: At discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post-baseline).
reported_events.desc: At discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post-baseline, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours) all possible adverse effects were monitored: significant changes in potassium and glucose and bicarbonate serum levels, electrocardiographic abnormalities or any clinical adverse effect. The last adverse event was detected 4 hours post-treatment.

group.title: Experimental Group
group.description: Dosing was individualized in four categories according to body weight Albuterol - Experimental: The Experimental group received higher doses of albuterol in the first hour: up to 15 kg of weight: 900 mcg; 15 to 20 kg: 1200 mcg; 20 to 25 kg: 1500; more than 25 kg: 1800 mcg

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Dosing was dived according to consensus recommendations in only two categories according to body weight Albuterol - Control: The Control group received 600 mcg for those with weight under 25kg and 1200 mcg for those grater than 25 kg

event.sub_title: non symptomatic mild hypokalemia at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post-baseline).
event.description: Non symptomatic mild hypokalemia in 17 patients, 10 in the control group, 7 in the experimental group. Only 2 patients showed values below 3.1 mEq/L. One patient in the experimental group: 2.8 mEq/L. One patient in the control group: 2.9mEq/L

event.sub_title: non symptomatic mild hyperglycemia at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post-baseline)
event.description: Non symptomatic mild hyperglycemia at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment). No patients needed medical intervention.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The inclusion of a larger number of patients in this study may have uncovered differences in the efficacy outcomes studied between the groups.
